channel.title: Janesh Devkota's Garden
channel.description: Recent content on Janesh Devkota's Garden

item.title: Books
item.description: Books Reading Now Into Thin Air - Jon Krakauer The Power of Now - Echart Tolle Books Read Rich dad poor dad The Alchemist Summary of the Alchemist Mens are from Mars, Women are from Venus The Fountainhead by Ayn Rand For men only, A straightforward guide to the inner lives of women May 2018 The organized mind Your one word by Evan Carmichael June 2018 The Outliers by Malcolm Galdwell The 10x Rule by Grant Cardone The Fred Factor by Mark Sanborne The new one Minute Manager Start with why by Simon Sinek Books to Read Everything happens for a reason by Kate Bowler Leonardo Da Vinci by Walter Isaacson Harry Potter and the Sorceror’s stone Total Money Makeover by Dave Ramsey The Intelligent Investor by Benjamin Graham Factfulness by Hans Rosling The power of Habit by Charles Duhigg Leaders Eat Last by Simon Sinek The monk who sold his Ferrari by Robin Sharma The gone girl by Gillian Flynn Sapiens - A Brief History of Humankind If you think I should read any particular book, please comment below and let me know the book’s name and author.

item.title: R Markdown template in Rstudio
item.description: I have been using the xarinagn package developed by Yihui Xie for a while now and have been using that to create presentations within my company. I really like what xaringan offers to the R users. I had modified the YAML of the markdown page a little so that I could have my own css file and my layout which displays company name and logo at the footer. I was copying and pasting the css file and logo file to all the presentation folder I would create.

item.title: Extracting water quality data from DataRetrieval R Package
item.description: In this blog post, I will be showing some capabilities of dataRetrieval package by USGS to extract water quality data. To install the dataRetrieval package use the following command: devtools::install_github(repo = "USGS-R/dataRetrieval") The main function I will be discussing is readWQPdata. The users can search the data using various options as shown below: bBox = Bounding box that uses the coordinates of lower left corner and upper right corner lat / long = lat / long will be specified by the user if they are interested to see if any data is available within radial distance.

item.title: Machine learning Cards from Twitter in R
item.description: I have been following Chris Albon on Twitter and have seen some really nice looking machine learning cards on his Twitter. While one can go to his website and buy all the cards he has produced. However, I was curious to see if I could download those flash cards in R. So, I started looking for a R package that would help to download the tweets by Chris Albon. I ended up using rtweet package for my analysis.

item.title: Spatial data and coordinate transformation in R
item.description: I come to these situations where I have to work with spatial datasets frequently. Sometimes the datasets is in lat-long format and sometimes on UTM (Universal transverse Mercator) coordinate or state plane coordinate system. I extensively use EFDC (Environmental Fluid Dynamic Code) model to do environmental modeling and have to convert the data into UTM coordinate system. I had used CORPSCON in the past but as an R enthusiast I wanted to dig deeper in R and finad a way to do the transformation in R environment.

item.title: 2015 Earthquake in Nepal : Earthquake magnitude and Casualty Analysis
item.description: In this blogpost, I am going to take the earthquake data from April 2015 to May 2016 throughout the World. Then we will process the data in usable form and look at the data on Nepal. Later, we will also dive into the casualties from this devastating earthquake. We will look at how many people died, got injured from which district, using ggplot2, wordcloud and leaflet package.

item.title: Fantasy Premier League Analysis in R
item.description: This is my first blog on data science topics. In this blog post, I will show you how to import the data from fantasy premier league into R and perform exploratory data analysis. ————- The questions that came up in my mind before doing this analysis are: How has Wayne Rooney been performing for the last several years ? How do Romelu Lukaku, Sergio Aguero, Harry Kane line up side by side ?

item.title: Publications / Presentations / Project Experience
item.description: Publications Devkota, J., Fang, X., and Fang, V. Z. (2013). “Response characteristics of Perdido and Wolf Bay system to inflows and sea level rise.” British Journal of Environment and Climate Change, 3(2), 229-256. Devkota, J., and Fang, X. (2014). “Numerical simulation of flow dynamics in a tidal river under various upstream hydrologic conditions.” Hydrological Sciences Journal, 1-24. Devkota, J., and Fang, X. (2015). “Quantification of Water and Salt Exchanges in a Tidal Estuary.

item.title: Welcome to my page
item.description: I am a water resources / environmental engineer currently working in Dynamic Solutions International LLC in Edmonds, WA. I completed my PhD from Auburn University in 2014 and completed masters in Civil Engineering (MCE) from Auburn University in Summer 2012. During my PhD in Auburn, I worked on number of projects that required numerical modeling, data analysis, data munging, data visualization and machine learning. I am a passionate scientist who loves explaining data science / data visualization to non-technical business audiences.
